item.title: Man pleads guilty to hacking networks to pitch security services
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: A Kansas City man has pleaded guilty to hacking multiple organizations to advertise his cybersecurity services, the U.S. Department of Justice announced on Wednesday. [...]

item.title: 3 key takeaways from the Scattered Spider attacks on insurance firms
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Push Security
item.description: Scattered Spider recently pivoted from targeting worldwide retailers to U.S. based insurance firms, with no signs of slowing down. Learn about Scattered Spider TTPs and how to defend your organization against MFA bypass, help desk scams, and more. [...]

item.title: Microsoft 365 'Direct Send' abused to send phishing as internal users
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: An ongoing phishing campaign abuses a little‑known feature in Microsoft 365 called "Direct Send" to evade detection by email security and steal credentials. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes Outlook bug causing crashes when opening emails
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has fixed a known issue that will cause the classic Outlook email client to crash when opening emails or starting a new message. [...]

item.title: Microsoft confirms Family Safety blocks Google Chrome from launching
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has confirmed that its Family Safety parental control service is blocking users from launching Google Chrome and other web browsers on Windows systems. [...]

item.title: CISA: AMI MegaRAC bug enabling server hijacks exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: CISA says a maximum severity vulnerability in AMI's MegaRAC Baseboard Management Controller (BMC) software, which enables attackers to hijack and brick servers, is currently under active exploitation. [...]

item.title: Hacker 'IntelBroker' charged in US for global data theft breaches
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A British national known online as "IntelBroker" has been charged by the U.S. for stealing and selling sensitive data from dozens of victims, causing an estimated $25 million in damages. [...]

item.title: Hackers turn ScreenConnect into malware using Authenticode stuffing
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Threat actors are abusing the ConnectWise ScreenConnect installer to build signed remote access malware by modifying hidden settings within the client's Authenticode signature. [...]

item.title: Hackers abuse Microsoft ClickOnce and AWS services for stealthy attacks
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: A sophisticated malicious campaign that researchers call OneClik has been leveraging Microsoft's ClickOnce software deployment tool and custom Golang backdoors to compromise organizations within the energy, oil, and gas sectors. [...]

item.title: New wave of ‘fake interviews’ use 35 npm packages to spread malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new wave of North Korea's 'Contagious Interview' campaign is targeting job seekers with malicious npm packages that infect dev's devices with infostealers and backdoors. [...]

item.title: Google releases Gemini CLI with free Gemini 2.5 Pro
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Google has released Gemini 2.5 Pro-powered Gemini CLI, which allows you to use Gemini inside your terminal, including Windows Terminal. [...]

item.title: Citrix warns of NetScaler vulnerability exploited in DoS attacks
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Citrix is warning that a vulnerability in NetScaler appliances tracked as CVE-2025-6543 is being actively exploited in the wild, causing devices to enter a denial of service condition. [...]

item.title: WinRAR patches bug letting malware launch from extracted archives
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: WinRAR has addressed a directory traversal vulnerability tracked as CVE-2025-6218 that, under certain circumstances, allows malware to be executed after extracting a malicious archive. [...]
